{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Videographer",
  "description": "At 5thWall Consulting, we are a dynamic outsourcing firm dedicated to providing end-to-end recruitment solutions for businesses across various industries. We specialize in helping organizations attract, assess, and hire top talent that aligns with their goals and culture.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Video Production Support:


	Assist the Lead Videographer in shooting property and lifestyle videos
	Handle basic camera setup and technical preparation
	Upload all raw video files within 24&ndash;48 hours after shoots
	Assist with editing and deliver final videos within agreed timelines
	Maintain consistent video quality standards


Editing &amp; Creative Support:


	Support video editing processes (transitions, sound, storytelling, etc.)
	Ensure revisions are implemented within 24 hours of request
	Maintain consistency in brand look and feel
	Continuously improve editing techniques and visual presentation


Marketing &amp; Campaign Alignment:
Ensure all video content aligns with:


	Active marketing campaigns
	Focal property projects
	Sales objectives
	Follow creative direction that supports business goals
	Research competitor content and high-performing industry videos
	Propose innovative ideas to enhance brand visibility and engagement


File &amp; Workflow Management:


	Ensure proper file naming, storage, and organization
	Maintain accessible and structured media folders
	Support efficient workflow between production and marketing teams.


Performance Expectations
Performance in this role is measured by:


	Timely upload of raw files (within 24&ndash;48 hours)
	Delivery of edited content within agreed timelines
	Prompt handling of revisions (within 24 hours)
	Meeting agreed monthly video output targets (including YouTube videos and podcasts)
	Quality progression in editing, sound, transitions, and storytelling
	Strong file management discipline
	Regular competitor research and idea contribution
	Responsiveness and collaboration with leadership
	During peak campaign periods, additional output may be required.


Professional Requirements:


	Basic to intermediate videography and editing skills
	Familiarity with editing software (e.g., Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, etc.)
	Strong organizational skills
	Ability to take direction and implement feedback quickly
	Interest in real estate marketing and brand storytelling
	Willingness to learn and improve (training support may be provided under agreed terms)


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.&nbsp;",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-11",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Videographer Job at 5thWall Consulting




        
    

        
        At 5thWall Consulting, we are a dynamic outsourcing firm dedicated to providing end-to-end recruitment solutions for businesses across various industries. We specialize in helping organizations attract, assess, and hire top talent that aligns with their goals and culture.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer
Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Video Production Support:
     

            
    




	Assist the Lead Videographer in shooting property and lifestyle videos
	Handle basic camera setup and technical preparation
	Upload all raw video files within 24–48 hours after shoots
	Assist with editing and deliver final videos within agreed timelines
	Maintain consistent video quality standards


Editing & Creative Support:


	Support video editing processes (transitions, sound, storytelling, etc.)
	Ensure revisions are implemented within 24 hours of request
	Maintain consistency in brand look and feel
	Continuously improve editing techniques and visual presentation


Marketing & Campaign Alignment:
Ensure all video content aligns with:


	Active marketing campaigns
	Focal property projects
	Sales objectives
	Follow creative direction that supports business goals
	Research competitor content and high-performing industry videos
	Propose innovative ideas to enhance brand visibility and engagement


File & Workflow Management:


	Ensure proper file naming, storage, and organization
	Maintain accessible and structured media folders
	Support efficient workflow between production and marketing teams.


Performance Expectations
Performance in this role is measured by:


	Timely upload of raw files (within 24–48 hours)
	Delivery of edited content within agreed timelines
	Prompt handling of revisions (within 24 hours)
	Meeting agreed monthly video output targets (including YouTube videos and podcasts)
	Quality progression in editing, sound, transitions, and storytelling
	Strong file management discipline
	Regular competitor research and idea contribution
	Responsiveness and collaboration with leadership
	During peak campaign periods, additional output may be required.


Professional Requirements:


	Basic to intermediate videography and editing skills
	Familiarity with editing software (e.g., Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, etc.)
	Strong organizational skills
	Ability to take direction and implement feedback quickly
	Interest in real estate marketing and brand storytelling
	Willingness to learn and improve (training support may be provided under agreed terms)


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphic Designer",
  "description": "Wellington College is one of the UK&rsquo;s great boarding schools, and is set in over 400 acres of beautiful parkland in Berkshire. It is a co-educational school for students aged13-18 years and is renowned for its pioneering approach and all-round excellence.

Wellington College seeks to be a vibrant, inspiring and challenging place which opens the minds and hearts of its pupils. Wellington College is a global leading IB school, and achieves consistently outstanding academic results in both IBDP and A Level, while also truly excelling in the arts, music and sports.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Graphic Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Epe, Lagos
Job type:&nbsp;Full Time (On-site)
Department:&nbsp;Marketing

Role Objective


	The Graphic Designer (Multimedia Designer)&nbsp;is responsible for&nbsp;producing&nbsp;high-quality&nbsp;visual assets that support Wellington College International Lagos&rsquo; brand, marketing campaigns, admissions activities, and community storytelling.
	This role ensures visual consistency across all touchpoints and contributes to the school&rsquo;s strong, premium brand identity.
	The Designer works closely with the Communications and Performance Marketing&nbsp;Managers&nbsp;to support digital, print, social, and&nbsp;event-related&nbsp;creative needs.&nbsp;


Key Responsibilities
Brand Design &amp; Visual Identity:


	Produce&nbsp;high-quality&nbsp;visual assets aligned with the brand identity and tone.&nbsp;
	Maintain brand consistency across campaigns, admissions materials, web assets, and social media.&nbsp;
	Develop and update templates for presentations, posters, signage, newsletters, and internal communications.&nbsp;


Digital Creative Production:


	Design graphics for social media, paid advertising, website banners, and email campaigns.&nbsp;
	Create engaging layouts for storytelling content in collaboration with the&nbsp;Communication and Performance Marketing Manager&nbsp;
	Prepare optimised digital assets for use across Meta, Google, and other platforms.&nbsp;


Print &amp; Collateral Design:


	Design admissions brochures, flyers, programme guides, event collateral, and environmental signage.&nbsp;
	Prepare&nbsp;print-ready&nbsp;files and manage revisions as needed.&nbsp;
	Liaise with printers and vendors to ensure quality production and&nbsp;timely&nbsp;delivery.&nbsp;


Event &amp; Campaign Support:


	Produce creative assets for Open Days, school tours, workshops, and community events.&nbsp;
	Support the Communications team with onsite materials, branded visuals, and signage.&nbsp;
	Collaborate with the Marketing &amp; Admissions Assistant on event&nbsp;logistics&nbsp;related to design deliverables.&nbsp;


Multimedia &amp; Light Video Editing:


	Capture simple photos or short clips when needed to support content creation.&nbsp;
	Perform basic video editing for social media, highlight reels, or short storytelling content.&nbsp;
	Support freelancers and external agencies for larger video projects.&nbsp;


Asset Management &amp; Workflow Support:


	Maintain the digital asset library, ensuring assets are organised, tagged, and easy to access.&nbsp;
	Manage version control and ensure design files are properly archived.&nbsp;
	Support efficient production workflows, meeting deadlines across multiple projects.&nbsp;
	Any other duties&nbsp;commensurate&nbsp;with the post&nbsp;
	N.B: The job description is not exhaustive and may be amended following&nbsp;appropriate consultation&nbsp;in the light of business needs.&nbsp;


Requirements
Experience and Skills:


	Ability to translate conceptual briefs into&nbsp;high-quality&nbsp;visual outcomes.&nbsp;
	Skilled in preparing assets for both print and digital use.&nbsp;
	Strong portfolio&nbsp;demonstrating&nbsp;both print and digital design capabilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Proficiency&nbsp;with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign; Premiere/After Effects a plus).&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Experience designing for campaigns, social media, and branded collateral.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Experience in an education, agency, or&nbsp;brand-focused&nbsp;environment preferred.&nbsp;
	Basic photography or video editing skills are beneficial.


Note:&nbsp;The successful candidate will also have to pass our safeguarding standards.",

Graphic Designer Job at Wellington College




        
    

        
        Wellington College is one of the UK’s great boarding schools, and is set in over 400 acres of beautiful parkland in Berkshire. It is a co-educational school for students aged13-18 years and is renowned for its pioneering approach and all-round excellence.

Wellington College seeks to be a vibrant, inspiring and challenging place which opens the minds and hearts of its pupils. Wellington College is a global leading IB school, and achieves consistently outstanding academic results in both IBDP and A Level, while also truly excelling in the arts, music and sports.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer
     

            
    



Job Location: Epe, Lagos
Job type: Full Time (On-site)
Department: Marketing

Role Objective


	The Graphic Designer (Multimedia Designer) is responsible for producing high-quality visual assets that support Wellington College International Lagos’ brand, marketing campaigns, admissions activities, and community storytelling.
	This role ensures visual consistency across all touchpoints and contributes to the school’s strong, premium brand identity.
	The Designer works closely with the Communications and Performance Marketing Managers to support digital, print, social, and event-related creative needs. 


Key Responsibilities
Brand Design & Visual Identity:


	Produce high-quality visual assets aligned with the brand identity and tone. 
	Maintain brand consistency across campaigns, admissions materials, web assets, and social media. 
	Develop and update templates for presentations, posters, signage, newsletters, and internal communications. 


Digital Creative Production:


	Design graphics for social media, paid advertising, website banners, and email campaigns. 
	Create engaging layouts for storytelling content in collaboration with the Communication and Performance Marketing Manager 
	Prepare optimised digital assets for use across Meta, Google, and other platforms. 


Print & Collateral Design:


	Design admissions brochures, flyers, programme guides, event collateral, and environmental signage. 
	Prepare print-ready files and manage revisions as needed. 
	Liaise with printers and vendors to ensure quality production and timely delivery. 


Event & Campaign Support:


	Produce creative assets for Open Days, school tours, workshops, and community events. 
	Support the Communications team with onsite materials, branded visuals, and signage. 
	Collaborate with the Marketing & Admissions Assistant on event logistics related to design deliverables. 


Multimedia & Light Video Editing:


	Capture simple photos or short clips when needed to support content creation. 
	Perform basic video editing for social media, highlight reels, or short storytelling content. 
	Support freelancers and external agencies for larger video projects. 


Asset Management & Workflow Support:


	Maintain the digital asset library, ensuring assets are organised, tagged, and easy to access. 
	Manage version control and ensure design files are properly archived. 
	Support efficient production workflows, meeting deadlines across multiple projects. 
	Any other duties commensurate with the post 
	N.B: The job description is not exhaustive and may be amended following appropriate consultation in the light of business needs. 


Requirements
Experience and Skills:


	Ability to translate conceptual briefs into high-quality visual outcomes. 
	Skilled in preparing assets for both print and digital use. 
	Strong portfolio demonstrating both print and digital design capabilities.  
	Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign; Premiere/After Effects a plus).  
	Experience designing for campaigns, social media, and branded collateral.  
	Experience in an education, agency, or brand-focused environment preferred. 
	Basic photography or video editing skills are beneficial.


Note: The successful candidate will also have to pass our safeguarding standards.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Admin / Secretary",
  "description": "Nocturnus Security Limited is a modern, fast-growing private security company specializing in excellent service delivery. We offer top-notch security services, leveraging cutting-edge gadgets and equipment to protect lives and properties. With extensive experience in industrial security, para-military, and intelligence organizations, our team is passionate about providing qualitative, customized, and quick responsive security solutions to diverse clients across Bayelsa, Rivers, FCT, and other states.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Secretary
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers

Job Description


	Types memos, correspondence, reports, and various routine forms, organizes workload to comply with deadlines and established priorities.
	Maintains non-complex departmental record keeping and filing systems, including records related to personnel, payroll, attendance, work and purchase orders, and so forth.
	Receives and screens visitors and telephone calls, and notifies appropriate personnel or records messages. Responds to general inquiries concerning department/unit activities and operations by relating to established policies and procedures.
	Posts information to records and logs maintains established files and prepares various ad-hoc reports according to directions from the supervisor.
	Monitoring office supplies and ordering replacements.


Requirements


	Requires a B.Sc / HND or equivalent.
	Three years of experience within an office setting preferred.
	Literacy and experience working with Microsoft Software Programs are required.
	Previous experience in scheduling appointment/maintaining Calendars preferred


Skills:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Exceptional interpersonal skills.
	Advanced proficiency in managing documents, spreadsheets, and databases.
	Ability to liaise internally and externally on administrative matters.
	Exceptional filing, recordkeeping, and organizational skills.
	Working knowledge of printers, copiers, scanners, and fax machines.


Salary
Attractive.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Motivation Letter to:&nbsp;victor.otunba@nocturnussecurity.com&nbsp;,&nbsp;info@nocturnussecurity.com&nbsp;using &quot;Admin / Secretary&quot; as the subject of the email.
Or
Submit a hard copy to:
Plot 86 Cadastral Zone, B06 Mabushi, Behind The Capital Hub, FCT Abuja (08065285332)
Plot 14A Agip Estate, Port-Harcourt, Rivers State (07070567555).",

Admin / Secretary Job at Nocturnus Security Limited




        
    

        
        Nocturnus Security Limited is a modern, fast-growing private security company specializing in excellent service delivery. We offer top-notch security services, leveraging cutting-edge gadgets and equipment to protect lives and properties. With extensive experience in industrial security, para-military, and intelligence organizations, our team is passionate about providing qualitative, customized, and quick responsive security solutions to diverse clients across Bayelsa, Rivers, FCT, and other states.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Secretary
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

Job Description
     

            
    




	Types memos, correspondence, reports, and various routine forms, organizes workload to comply with deadlines and established priorities.
	Maintains non-complex departmental record keeping and filing systems, including records related to personnel, payroll, attendance, work and purchase orders, and so forth.
	Receives and screens visitors and telephone calls, and notifies appropriate personnel or records messages. Responds to general inquiries concerning department/unit activities and operations by relating to established policies and procedures.
	Posts information to records and logs maintains established files and prepares various ad-hoc reports according to directions from the supervisor.
	Monitoring office supplies and ordering replacements.


Requirements


	Requires a B.Sc / HND or equivalent.
	Three years of experience within an office setting preferred.
	Literacy and experience working with Microsoft Software Programs are required.
	Previous experience in scheduling appointment/maintaining Calendars preferred


Skills:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Exceptional interpersonal skills.
	Advanced proficiency in managing documents, spreadsheets, and databases.
	Ability to liaise internally and externally on administrative matters.
	Exceptional filing, recordkeeping, and organizational skills.
	Working knowledge of printers, copiers, scanners, and fax machines.


Salary
Attractive.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Motivation Letter to: [email protected] , [email protected] using "Admin / Secretary" as the subject of the email.
Or
Submit a hard copy to:
Plot 86 Cadastral Zone, B06 Mabushi, Behind The Capital Hub, FCT Abuja (08065285332)
Plot 14A Agip Estate, Port-Harcourt, Rivers State (07070567555).

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Website and Media Social Manager",
  "description": "Posh Reporters, is your go-to digital news platform for fresh, credible, and comprehensive reporting. Whether you&rsquo;re seeking breaking news, insightful analysis, or in-depth coverage of the stories that shape our world, we deliver with clarity, passion, and integrity.

Posh Reporters is an independent online news outlet dedicated to keeping you informed on local, national, and global issues. With a seasoned team of journalists, editors, and contributors, we strive to go beyond headlines, offering meaningful context, balanced perspectives, and fact-based storytelling.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Website and Media Social Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are in search of a Website and Social media manager to create, curate, and manage all published content (images, video, written). Monitor, listen, and respond to users in a social way while cultivating leads and sales. Analyze key metrics and adjust strategies to meet business goals.
	Aspects of overseeing our website, ensuring it is up to date, engaging, and advances the mission and vision of the organization. The ideal candidate will have experience with website design (UI/UX) and technical development, troubleshooting, as well as a strong understanding of search engine optimization and analytics.


Roles and Responsibilities


	Lead the creation of site content and features to continually improve the website user experience and support the organization&rsquo;s goals and strategies.
	Manage the website&rsquo;s content, including writing new content, creating new pages and functionality, implementing/maintaining/sunsetting plugins and bespoke code solutions, editing and auditing existing content, and removing outdated content
	Generate meaningful content on all social media platforms. It encompasses areas such as writing and editing social media posts, growing customer engagement, and supporting social media campaigns
	Stay up to date with the latest web design and development trends and technologies. Identify ways to improve website UX, identifying and fulfilling opportunities for website improvement based on user feedback and performance metrics
	Produce, edit, distribute and share engaging content on a regular basis (e.g. original text, photos, videos, and news)
	Identify and troubleshoot website technical issues. Ensure website functionality and perform software updates. Update website coding frequently as needed.
	Supervise social media accounts&rsquo; posts to ensure the design and brand consistency (e.g. Facebook timeline cover, profile pictures, and blog layout)
	Recommend and implement new initiatives to develop brand awareness such as promotions, events, and contests
	Monitor, assess, and report on website performance. Monitor site analytics and develop monitoring dashboards for performance tracking. Work closely with internal teams to advise on Web Analytics data use &amp; strategy, and content developmen
	Increase traffic and engagement to the website. Apply SEO and SEM best practices and strategies
	Develop scripts and code centered on digital attribution, user tracking and tag management. Assist with social media campaigns and other marketing efforts. Manage pay-per-click, Google Ads, and search engine optimization campaigns


Qualifications


	3+ years of experience in web design development and Social Media management with proven experience.
	Strong working knowledge and experience with Content Management Systems and in particular WordPress
	Demonstrated experience with web design and UX
	Proficiency with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and backend revisions/improvements
	Working knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics).


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;Recruitwithwumi@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-11",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-28",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Posh Reporters"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

    }

}



Website and Media Social Manager Job at Posh Reporters




        
    

        
        Posh Reporters, is your go-to digital news platform for fresh, credible, and comprehensive reporting. Whether you’re seeking breaking news, insightful analysis, or in-depth coverage of the stories that shape our world, we deliver with clarity, passion, and integrity.

Posh Reporters is an independent online news outlet dedicated to keeping you informed on local, national, and global issues. With a seasoned team of journalists, editors, and contributors, we strive to go beyond headlines, offering meaningful context, balanced perspectives, and fact-based storytelling.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Website and Media Social Manager
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are in search of a Website and Social media manager to create, curate, and manage all published content (images, video, written). Monitor, listen, and respond to users in a social way while cultivating leads and sales. Analyze key metrics and adjust strategies to meet business goals.
	Aspects of overseeing our website, ensuring it is up to date, engaging, and advances the mission and vision of the organization. The ideal candidate will have experience with website design (UI/UX) and technical development, troubleshooting, as well as a strong understanding of search engine optimization and analytics.


Roles and Responsibilities


	Lead the creation of site content and features to continually improve the website user experience and support the organization’s goals and strategies.
	Manage the website’s content, including writing new content, creating new pages and functionality, implementing/maintaining/sunsetting plugins and bespoke code solutions, editing and auditing existing content, and removing outdated content
	Generate meaningful content on all social media platforms. It encompasses areas such as writing and editing social media posts, growing customer engagement, and supporting social media campaigns
	Stay up to date with the latest web design and development trends and technologies. Identify ways to improve website UX, identifying and fulfilling opportunities for website improvement based on user feedback and performance metrics
	Produce, edit, distribute and share engaging content on a regular basis (e.g. original text, photos, videos, and news)
	Identify and troubleshoot website technical issues. Ensure website functionality and perform software updates. Update website coding frequently as needed.
	Supervise social media accounts’ posts to ensure the design and brand consistency (e.g. Facebook timeline cover, profile pictures, and blog layout)
	Recommend and implement new initiatives to develop brand awareness such as promotions, events, and contests
	Monitor, assess, and report on website performance. Monitor site analytics and develop monitoring dashboards for performance tracking. Work closely with internal teams to advise on Web Analytics data use & strategy, and content developmen
	Increase traffic and engagement to the website. Apply SEO and SEM best practices and strategies
	Develop scripts and code centered on digital attribution, user tracking and tag management. Assist with social media campaigns and other marketing efforts. Manage pay-per-click, Google Ads, and search engine optimization campaigns


Qualifications


	3+ years of experience in web design development and Social Media management with proven experience.
	Strong working knowledge and experience with Content Management Systems and in particular WordPress
	Demonstrated experience with web design and UX
	Proficiency with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and backend revisions/improvements
	Working knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics).


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
